level.heading: Department requirements for placements of individuals and families in permanent supportive housing.

level.text: All permanent supportive housing placements funded exclusively with non-federal funds shall be filled by appropriate homeless individuals or families as identified by the Department.
Each permanent supportive housing placement shall be filled no later than 60 days after the day funding for the placement becomes available.
The Department shall review all assessments of individuals and families to identify which individual or family is appropriate to fill the available placement.

level.heading: Effect of amendments
level.text: The 2014 amendment by D.C. Law 20-129 added this section.

level.heading: Legislative history of Law 20-129
level.text: Law 20-129, the “Homeless Services Reform Amendment Act of 2014,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 20-679. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 8, 2014, and May 6, 2014, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 2, 2014, it was assigned Act No. 20-346 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 20-129 became effective on July 23, 2014.
